title: Marketing Manager Job at Recruit with Adenike
content:
Recruit with Adenike is a recruitment and talent solutions brand committed to connecting high-performing professionals with forward-thinking organizations across diverse industries. From entry-level roles to executive placements, we help businesses attract, engage, and retain the right talent to fuel growth and success. Our approach is efficient, personalized, and rooted in a deep understanding of people and business needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Country Head

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly strategic and experienced Marketing Manager to lead and execute our marketing initiatives in Nigeria. Based onsite in Ikeja, Lagos, this role is ideal for a marketing leader with a solid track record in the fintech or financial services sector.
	You will be responsible for driving product visibility, customer acquisition, retention, and brand growth across multiple channels. Reporting directly to the Country Head, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our marketing strategy supports business objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement end-to-end marketing strategies for fintech products (e.g., digital payments, wallets, loans)
	Plan and execute digital campaigns (SEO, SEM, paid media, email marketing, content marketing)
	Lead market research initiatives to understand customer behavior and market trends
	Build and maintain brand identity and customer engagement across touchpoints
	Oversee go-to-market planning for new product features and launches
	Manage performance marketing and analyze key metrics to measure ROI
	Collaborate with internal teams (product, sales, compliance) to align messaging and positioning
	Manage vendor relationships, marketing budgets, and external agencies
	Ensure compliance with regulatory standards (e.g., CBN, NDPR) in all communications


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field
	Minimum of 7 years of relevant marketing experience, with at least 3 years in fintech or financial services
	Proven experience managing digital marketing campaigns and driving measurable growth
	Strong knowledge of tools like Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, CRM platforms, and marketing automation tools
	Excellent communication, project management, and stakeholder management skills
	Analytical mindset and ability to interpret data into actionable strategy
	Ability to lead cross-functional initiatives and work in a fast-paced environment


Preferred Qualifications:


	Master’s degree or certifications in marketing or digital strategy
	Experience working in high-growth startups or scaling tech products
	Familiarity with financial regulations and marketing compliance standards in Nigeria
	Team leadership or mentorship experience is a plus


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitmentforce.africa@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Accountant Job at Oyomesi Specialist Hospital
content:
Oyomesi Specialist Hospital is a leading healthcare institution committed to delivering high-quality, patient-centered medical care. Located in Ibadan, Oyo State, we offer a wide range of specialized services across various medical fields, including general medicine, diagnostics, surgery, maternal and child health, and emergency care.

With a team of dedicated healthcare professionals and state-of-the-art medical equipment, we are focused on improving health outcomes through excellence in clinical practice, compassionate service, and continuous innovation. Our hospital operates with the highest standards of professionalism, ethics, and safety, ensuring that every patient receives timely and effective treatment in a comfortable environment.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Wev are seeking a qualified and detail-oriented Accountant to manage the hospital’s financial operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and support strategic financial planning.
	The ideal candidate will have a solid background in accounting and financial reporting, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage financial records and reports accurately and efficiently.
	Prepare and analyze financial statements.
	Monitor cash flow and perform bank reconciliations.
	Ensure compliance with accounting regulations and relevant tax laws.
	Oversee accounts payable and receivable.
	Provide financial insights to support hospital operations and decision-making.
	Assist in audits and prepare necessary documentation.


Qualifications & Experience


	A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or a related field.
	2–3 years of experience in accounting and financial management, preferably in a healthcare or corporate setting.
	Professional certification such as ACCA, ACA, CPA, or ICAN is required.
	Proficient in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and reporting skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and ability to manage multiple financial tasks.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: oyomesispecialisthospitals@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Operations Safety Engineer (OSE) Job at WTS Energy
content:
WTS Energy provides recruitment and manpower services for the global oil and gas and energy industries. We supply engineers and consultants to our clients' projects and operations, and perform employment outsourcing services such as workforce management in oil and gas regions around the world. WTS Energy operates globally with offices in 14 countries and is operational in over 50 countries.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Safety Engineer (OSE)
Job Location: Lagos (with occasional visits to sites)

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Support the DW FOPS Operations Safety Leader to ensure manpower, equipment, services and procedures are adequate to comply with Regulatory Codes & Standards, Company Rules and Best practices as far as Safety and Environment are concerned.
	Role to be transversely engaged within Field Operations disciplines and on-board personnel in diffusing HSE philosophy and training with a view to continually improve COMPANY Safety Culture
	DW Field Operations annual HSE performance tracking to ensure consistency with the HSE objectives set.


Key Responsibilties


	Assists the DW FOPS Operations Safety Leader in the implementation of the Health, Safety and Environment standards & objectives, in compliance with the One MAESTRO, COMPANY HSE Management System and other COMPANY Referential.
	Support the DW FOPS OSL to actively lead Company HSE awareness and initiative schemes, ensure compliance with/application of all relevant statutory and Company HSE standards on the operational sites
	In liaison with the DW FOPS OSL, act as a focal point for all HSE statistics reporting relating to DW Field Operations onshore and offshore activities weekly (Collates for review anomaly reports issued from DW Onshore and record/trend incident reports from DW Offshore)
	Ensure HSE training requirements for all DWA FOPS personnel (staff and contract) are completely captured in SafePass, HSEPass and ePOB as the case may be; then monitor to drive compliance and report HSE training performance weekly.
	Develop DW FOPS monthly HSE Performance reports following the direction of the DW FOPS OSL and assist in the preparation, coordination and organization of the quarterly base HSE Committee Meetings (CODIV)
	Facilitate and participate in contractors HSE MS audits; operational sites HSE audits & inspections as well as report, monitor and update all actions emanating from them, including OPERSAFE and MAESTRO Audit corrective actions
	Stand down review of Incident/REX notifications and their Synergi cases, then follow up the implementation of all DW FOPS actions in Synergi arising from incident investigation reports, audits implementation, etc.
	Assist the DW FOPS OSL in preparation of reports on key HSE events and related DW FOPS activities (FORUM, CODIV, STANDOWN, AWAY-DAY, etc), then monitor DW Field Operations HSE Performances (objectives, activity plan, KPI)
	Participate in hazard studies / risk assessments undertaken for the modification of installations and the execution of operations when the need arises to ensure the safe execution of operations; and that risks are adequately managed
	Create new HSE material/equipment after validating the specifications with DW FOPS OSL, raise MRFs/SRF for procurement of HSE consumables /services for site operations; follow up with responsible supply chain parties (buyer, FOPS materials coordinator, transit, Stock controller, LADOL materials Supt, etc) till delivery to site.
	Monitor as the Decentralized Purchase Person the HSE consumables and services supply chain processes for unassigned PRs, unreleased PRs, POs, and SES; then promptly highlight to the DWA FOPS OSL for intervention. Participate in the supply chain
	DUET meetings to drive availability of HSE consumable materials.
	Lead specific Operations Safety reviews in support of Request for Modification (RFM) process and Downgraded Situations (DGS)  HAZOP, HAZID, etc.
	Support operational entities in Call-For-Tender Risk Assessment and Derogation preparation.Transverse follow up of HSE budget executors to ensure work plans are adequately captured in the IOP plan; work scope executed as plan and the invoices submitted in a timely manner for all scope executed
	Contribute to development of REX from event/activity reports; distribution of REX (HSE alerts, FBN, SFN) and follow up implementation of REX recommendations
	Follow up of the implementation of the DW FOPS HSEQ activity plan in line with the HSEQ objectives set for the year to ensure adequate monitoring, regular update and effective communication of the HSEQ activities.
	Participate in the review of key operational HSE document (SIMOPS/HSE Dossiers, specific procedures, bridging document, etc.)
	Coordinate and deliver (where required) identified HSE training needs of existing asset personnel and follow up their HSE training compliance (company and contractor); also support the DW FOPS OSL in providing relevant HSE awareness sessions to new persons arriving the division.
	Participate in site operations Emergency Preparedness and implementation as required including drafting of Emergency.


Educational Requirements


	Engineering Degree in Civil, Electrical, Mechanical, Petroleum or Safety, fluent in English with good communication skills
	Professional Experience: 5 years in Oil and Gas (E&P), 3 years in HSE position.
	Experience in a construction and operation environment, in Safety Engineering techniques, (HAZOP, PTR, HAZID and Audits).

title: Inventory Officer (Retail) Job at Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores
content:
Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores is a proudly Nigerian, multi-service retail brand committed to meeting the everyday needs of our customers through quality products, excellent service, and community-focused operations. We operate a unique combination of businesses under one roof, making us a convenient and trusted destination for families and individuals alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer (Retail)

Job Location: Gudu, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Inventory Officer to manage stock levels across our pharmacy, supermarket, bakery, and restaurant operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure accurate record-keeping, prevent stock losses, and maintain optimal inventory levels to support daily business operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate inventory records using software and manual logs.
	Monitor stock levels and initiate restocking where necessary.
	Conduct regular physical stock counts and reconcile with system records.
	Investigate discrepancies and report inventory issues promptly.
	Implement and maintain inventory control procedures.
	Track incoming and outgoing items and ensure proper documentation.
	Coordinate with procurement, store, and department heads for stock movement.
	Prevent stock losses through proper handling, storage, and monitoring.
	Prepare inventory reports and submit to management regularly.


Education & Qualifications


	Minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc. in Business Administration, Supply Chain, Accounting, or related field.
	Professional certification in inventory, storekeeping, or logistics is an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 3 - 4years of experience in inventory management, stock control, or a related role.
	Experience in retail, pharmacy, or food service industry preferred.


Other Requirements:


	Must reside within or near [Gudu, Apo, Lokogoma or surrounding areas
	Must be physically fit and able to handle inventory tasks
	Must be available for immediate employment


Required Skills & Competencies:


	Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	Good analytical and numerical skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or inventory software(PHP)
	Organizational and time management skills
	Ability to work independently and within a team
	Good communication and reporting skills
	Integrity and a high level of accountability


Remuneration


	Salary: N130,000 - N150,000 / month.
	Competitive salary based on experience


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: hiring436@gmail.com using "Inventory Officer Application" as the subject of the email.
